skill.name: arboreto
skill.description: Infer gene regulatory networks (GRNs) from gene expression data using scalable algorithms (GRNBoost2, GENIE3). Use when analyzing transcriptomics data (bulk RNA-seq, single-cell RNA-seq) to identify transcription factor-target gene relationships and regulatory interactions. Supports distributed computation for large-scale datasets.
skill.summary: Infer gene regulatory networks (GRNs) from gene expression data using scalable algorithms (GRNBoost2...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Arboreto is a legitimate bioinformatics tool for gene regulatory network inference. All 116 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES: the scanner misidentified markdown code blocks as shell commands, YAML frontmatter as cryptographic code, and standard Dask cluster IP addresses as suspicious network targets. The skill reads/writes user-provided data files, uses standard ML libraries (pandas, scikit-learn), and has no malicious patterns, credential access, or network exfiltration.

content.user_title: Infer gene regulatory networks from expression data
content.value_statement: Analyzing transcriptomics data to identify gene regulatory interactions is time-consuming and requires specialized algorithms. Arboreto provides GRNBoost2 and GENIE3 algorithms for scalable gene regulatory network inference from bulk RNA-seq or single-cell RNA-seq data.
actual_capabilities: Infer gene regulatory networks from gene expression matrices using GRNBoost2 algorithm
Run GENIE3 Random Forest-based GRN inference for comparison and validation
Filter results by transcription factor lists for targeted analysis
Scale computation across local multi-core processors or distributed clusters via Dask
Export regulatory networks as TSV files with importance scores
Integrate with pySCENIC pipeline for comprehensive single-cell regulatory analysis
limitations: Does not perform network visualization or downstream pathway analysis
Requires pre-processed expression data in specific format (genes as columns)
Memory intensive for very large datasets without distributed computing setup
Results require biological validation; importance scores indicate correlation, not causation

use_cases.title: Single-cell GRN analysis
use_cases.description: Identify cell-type-specific transcription factor-target gene relationships from scRNA-seq data.

use_cases.title: Bulk RNA-seq network inference
use_cases.description: Build regulatory networks from bulk transcriptomics experiments across multiple conditions.

use_cases.title: SCENIC pipeline integration
use_cases.description: Use arboreto as the GRN inference step in the SCENIC regulon discovery workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Basic GRN inference
prompt_templates.scenario: Load expression data and run GRNBoost2
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the arboreto skill to infer a gene regulatory network from my expression matrix at data/expression.tsv. Output results to results/network.tsv.

prompt_templates.title: With TF filtering
prompt_templates.scenario: Restrict analysis to known transcription factors
prompt_templates.prompt: Run GRNBoost2 inference using arboreto on data/expression.tsv with transcription factors from data/tfs.txt. Save to results/tf_network.tsv.

prompt_templates.title: Algorithm comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Run both GRNBoost2 and GENIE3 using arboreto on data/expression.tsv. Compare the top regulatory links from each algorithm.

prompt_templates.title: Distributed computation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use arboreto with a Dask distributed client to infer a GRN from large scRNA-seq data. Connect to tcp://cluster:8786 scheduler.

output_examples.input: Infer gene regulatory network from expression_data.tsv using arboreto, output to network.tsv
output: Results saved to network.tsv with columns: TF, target, importance

output_examples.input: Run GENIE3 on bulk RNA-seq data with human transcription factors
output: Inferred 23,567 regulatory links from 500 genes x 48 samples
Top TF-gene associations saved to rnaseq_grn.tsv

output_examples.input: Use distributed computing to analyze 50,000 cell scRNA-seq dataset
output: Connected to Dask cluster at tcp://scheduler:8786
Distributed inference across 8 workers completed in 45 minutes

best_practices: Always use if __name__ == '__main__' guard when running scripts to prevent Dask process spawning issues
Set a random seed for reproducible results across runs
Filter to known transcription factors to reduce computation time and improve relevance
anti_patterns: Running arboreto on raw read counts without normalization or filtering
Interpreting importance scores as definitive causal relationships without validation
Ignoring memory requirements for large datasets; use distributed computing for >10,000 cells

faq.question: What expression data format does arboreto support?
faq.answer: Arboreto accepts pandas DataFrames or NumPy arrays with genes as columns and observations as rows.

faq.question: How many genes can arboreto handle?
faq.answer: GRNBoost2 handles 10,000+ observations efficiently. Very large datasets require distributed Dask computing.

faq.question: Can arboreto integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, arboreto integrates with pySCENIC for regulon discovery and Dask for distributed computing on clusters.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using arboreto?
faq.answer: Arboreto processes data locally. It only reads and writes files you specify and makes no external network calls.

faq.question: Why are my results different on each run?
faq.answer: GRNBoost2 uses stochastic algorithms. Set a seed parameter for reproducibility or run multiple seeds for robustness.

faq.question: How does arboreto compare to other GRN tools?
faq.answer: GRNBoost2 is faster than GENIE3 for large data. GENIE3 uses Random Forests while GRNBoost2 uses gradient boosting.
